meanings.definition: To deprive of possession or occupancy
meanings.sent1: The landlord disseises the tenant of the apartment.
meanings.sent2: The government disseises the squatters from the abandoned building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous ghost disseises the family from their home every Halloween.
meanings.sent4: The storm disseises the birds from their nests in the trees.
meanings.sent5: The thief disseises the museum of its precious artifacts under the cover of night.

meanings.definition: To dispossess or evict from property
meanings.sent1: The court order disseises the trespassers from the private land.
meanings.sent2: The bank disseises the homeowners for failing to pay the mortgage.
meanings.sent3: The magician disseises the audience from their disbelief with his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent4: The new law disseises the developers from building on protected land.
meanings.sent5: The flood disseises the residents from their houses along the riverbank.
